paras.en: If you do much work on computers, eventually you find that there’s some task you’d like to automate. For example, you may wish to perform a search-and-replace over a large number of text files, or rename and rearrange a bunch of photo files in a complicated way. Perhaps you’d like to write a small custom database, or a specialized GUI application, or a simple game.
paras.cn: 如果你在电脑上做了很多工作，最终你会发现有些任务是你想要自动化的。例如，你可能希望在一个大批量的文本文件上执行搜索和替换，或者以复杂的方式重命名和重新排列一堆照片文件。也许你想编写一个小型自定义数据库，或者一个专门的GUI应用程序，或者一个简单的游戏。

vocab.ex: The factory uses robots to automate the assembly line.
vocab.tr: 工厂使用机器人来自动化装配线。

vocab.ex: Most word processors have a search-and-replace function.
vocab.tr: 大多数文字处理器都有搜索和替换功能。

vocab.ex: Can you rearrange the furniture in this room to make it look bigger?
vocab.tr: 你能重新摆放这个房间里的家具，让它看起来更大吗？

vocab.ex: The tailor made a custom suit for the client.
vocab.tr: 裁缝为客户量身定做了一套西装。

vocab.ex: She has specialized knowledge in the field of artificial intelligence.
vocab.tr: 她在人工智能领域拥有专业知识。

vocab.mean: 图形用户界面应用程序
vocab.ex: Most modern software has a graphical user interface (GUI) application.
vocab.tr: 大多数现代软件都有图形用户界面（GUI）应用程序。

paras.en: If you’re a professional software developer, you may have to work with several C/C++/Java libraries but find the usual write/compile/test/re-compile cycle is too slow. Perhaps you’re writing a test suite for such a library and find writing the testing code a tedious task. Or maybe you’ve written a program that could use an extension language, and you don’t want to design and implement a whole new language for your application.
paras.cn: 如果你是一名专业的软件开发人员，你可能不得不使用多个 C/C++/Java 库，但发现通常的编写/编译/测试/重新编译周期太慢了。也许你正在为一个这样的库编写测试套件，并发现编写测试代码是一项繁琐的任务。或者你可能已经编写了一个可以使用扩展语言的程序，而你又不想为你的应用程序设计和实现全新的语言。

vocab.ex: He is a professional programmer who works for a large tech company.
vocab.tr: 他是一名专业的程序员，为一家大科技公司工作。

vocab.ex: Programmers often use pre-written libraries to speed up development.
vocab.tr: 程序员经常使用预先编写的库来加速开发。

vocab.ex: The C++ code needs to be compiled before it can be run.
vocab.tr: C++代码在运行之前需要编译。

vocab.ex: The write/compile/test/re-compile cycle can be time-consuming.
vocab.tr: 编写/编译/测试/重新编译的周期可能会耗费大量时间。

vocab.ex: Testing code manually can be a tedious task.
vocab.tr: 手动测试代码是一项乏味的任务。

vocab.ex: Many applications allow integration with an extension language for customization.
vocab.tr: 许多应用程序允许与扩展语言集成以进行自定义。

vocab.ex: The developers decided to implement a new feature for the software.
vocab.tr: 开发人员决定为该软件实现一项新功能。

paras.en: Python is just the language for you.
paras.cn: Python 就是为你而生的语言。

vocab.ex: If you want to learn about data science, Python is just the language for you.
vocab.tr: 如果你想学习数据科学，Python就是为你而生的语言。

paras.en: You could write a Unix shell script or Windows batch files for some of these tasks, but shell scripts are best at moving around files and changing text data, not well-suited for GUI applications or games. You could write a C/C++/Java program, but it can take a lot of development time to get even a first-draft program. Python is simpler to use, available on Windows, macOS, and Unix operating systems, and will help you get the job done more quickly.
paras.cn: 你可以为其中一些任务编写Unix shell脚本或Windows批处理文件，但shell脚本最擅长移动文件和更改文本数据，不适合GUI应用程序或游戏。你可以编写C/C++/Java程序，但即使是初稿程序也可能需要大量的开发时间。Python更简单易用，在Windows、macOS和Unix操作系统上都可用，并且能帮助你更快地完成工作。

vocab.ex: Many system administrators use Unix shell scripts to automate tasks.
vocab.tr: 许多系统管理员使用Unix Shell脚本来自动化任务。

vocab.ex: Windows batch files can be used to run a sequence of commands.
vocab.tr: Windows批处理文件可用于运行一系列命令。

vocab.ex: This language is well-suited for rapid application development.
vocab.tr: 这种语言非常适合快速应用程序开发。

vocab.mean: 图形用户界面应用程序
vocab.ex: Most modern software has a graphical user interface (GUI) application.
vocab.tr: 大多数现代软件都有图形用户界面（GUI）应用程序。

vocab.ex: The development time for this project was much longer than expected.
vocab.tr: 这个项目的开发时间比预期的要长得多。

paras.en: Python is simple to use, but it is a real programming language, offering much more structure and support for large programs than shell scripts or batch files can offer. On the other hand, Python also offers much more error checking than C, and, being a very-high-level language, it has high-level data types built in, such as flexible arrays and dictionaries. Because of its more general data types Python is applicable to a much larger problem domain than Awk or even Perl, yet many things are at least as easy in Python as in those languages.
paras.cn: Python易于使用，但它是一门真正的编程语言，比shell脚本或批处理文件提供更多的结构和对大型程序的更多支持。另一方面，Python还提供了比C语言多得多的错误检查，并且，作为一门非常高级的语言，它内置了高级数据类型，如灵活的数组和字典。由于其更通用的数据类型，Python比Awk甚至Perl更适用于更广泛的问题领域，但许多事情在Python中至少与那些语言一样容易。

vocab.ex: The programming language offers more structure and support for large programs.
vocab.tr: 该编程语言为大型程序提供了更多的结构和支持。

vocab.ex: Python offers much more error checking than C.
vocab.tr: Python提供比C语言更多的错误检查。

vocab.mean: 高级的（指离人类语言近，远离机器语言）
vocab.ex: Python is a high-level language that is easy to read and write.
vocab.tr: Python是一门高级语言，易于阅读和编写。

vocab.ex: Common data types include integers, strings, and booleans.
vocab.tr: 常见的数据类型包括整数、字符串和布尔值。

vocab.ex: Python's flexible arrays and dictionaries are very useful.
vocab.tr: Python灵活的数组和字典非常有用。

vocab.ex: This software is applicable to a wide range of industries.
vocab.tr: 这款软件适用于广泛的行业。

vocab.ex: The programming language is suitable for a broad problem domain.
vocab.tr: 该编程语言适用于广泛的问题领域。

paras.en: Python allows you to split your program into modules that can be reused in other Python programs. It comes with a large collection of standard modules that you can use as the basis of your programs — or as examples to start learning to program in Python. Some of these modules provide things like file I/O, system calls, sockets, and even interfaces to graphical user interface toolkits like Tk.
paras.cn: Python允许你将程序分割成可以在其他Python程序中重用的模块。它附带了一个庞大的标准模块集合，你可以用它们作为你程序的基石——或者作为开始学习Python编程的例子。其中一些模块提供了文件I/O、系统调用、套接字，甚至像Tk这样的图形用户界面工具包的接口。

vocab.ex: You can split your program into smaller, reusable modules.
vocab.tr: 你可以将程序分割成更小的、可重用的模块。

vocab.ex: A program can be broken down into several modules for better organization.
vocab.tr: 程序可以分解成几个模块以获得更好的组织。

vocab.ex: Writing modular code allows modules to be reused in different projects.
vocab.tr: 编写模块化代码可以允许在不同项目中重用模块。

vocab.ex: The library has a large collection of books on various subjects.
vocab.tr: 图书馆藏有各种学科的大量书籍。

vocab.ex: These examples can serve as the basis for learning new concepts.
vocab.tr: 这些例子可以作为学习新概念的基础。

vocab.ex: File I/O operations are fundamental to most programming tasks.
vocab.tr: 文件I/O操作是大多数编程任务的基础。

vocab.ex: Operating systems use system calls to interact with hardware.
vocab.tr: 操作系统使用系统调用与硬件交互。

vocab.ex: Network programs use sockets to communicate over the internet.
vocab.tr: 网络程序使用套接字在互联网上进行通信。

vocab.ex: The software provides an interface to access the database.
vocab.tr: 该软件提供了一个访问数据库的接口。

vocab.ex: The programming language comes with a standard GUI toolkit.
vocab.tr: 这门编程语言附带了一个标准的GUI工具集。

paras.en: Python is an interpreted language, which can save you considerable time during program development because no compilation and linking is necessary. The interpreter can be used interactively, which makes it easy to experiment with features of the language, to write throw-away programs, or to test functions during bottom-up program development. It is also a handy desk calculator.
paras.cn: Python是一种解释型语言，可以在程序开发过程中为您节省大量时间，因为无需进行编译和链接。解释器可以交互式使用，这使得您可以轻松地试验该语言的功能，编写一次性程序，或者在自下而上的程序开发过程中测试函数。它也是一个方便的桌面计算器。

vocab.ex: Unlike compiled languages like C++, Python is an interpreted language.
vocab.tr: 与C++等编译型语言不同，Python是一种解释型语言。

vocab.ex: Learning a new language requires considerable time and effort.
vocab.tr: 学习一门新语言需要大量的时间和精力。

vocab.ex: The compilation process converts source code into executable code.
vocab.tr: 编译过程将源代码转换为可执行代码。

vocab.ex: Linking is the process of combining compiled code modules into an executable program.
vocab.tr: 链接是将编译后的代码模块组合成可执行程序的过程。

vocab.ex: The interpreter can be used interactively, making it easy to experiment with the language.
vocab.tr: 解释器可以交互式使用，从而可以轻松地试验该语言。

vocab.ex: He wrote several throw-away scripts for testing small ideas.
vocab.tr: 他写了几个一次性的脚本来测试小想法。

vocab.ex: The team used a bottom-up approach to build the software.
vocab.tr: 团队采用自下而上的方法来构建软件。

vocab.ex: A good dictionary is a handy tool for any language learner.
vocab.tr: 一本好的词典是任何语言学习者的便利工具。

paras.cn:
Python 可以使程序以紧凑且可读的方式编写。Python 程序通常比等效的 C、C++ 或 Java 程序短得多，原因有几个：

- 高级数据类型允许您用单个语句表达复杂的操作；
- 语句分组是通过缩进完成的，而不是通过开始和结束括号；
- 不需要变量或参数声明。

vocab.ex: The presentation was delivered in a compact and informative way.
vocab.tr: 演示以紧凑而信息丰富的方式进行。

vocab.ex: The code was written in a clear and readable style.
vocab.tr: 代码以清晰易读的风格编写。

vocab.ex: This error typically occurs when the software is outdated.
vocab.tr: 当软件过时时，通常会发生此错误。

vocab.ex: The C++ program performs a similar function to the Python script.
vocab.tr: C++程序执行的功能与Python脚本类似。

vocab.ex: Python uses indentation to group statements instead of curly braces.
vocab.tr: Python使用缩进来对语句进行分组，而不是使用花括号。

vocab.ex: In Python, you don't need variable declarations; you can just start using them.
vocab.tr: 在Python中，你不需要变量声明；你可以直接开始使用它们。

paras.en: Python is extensible: if you know how to program in C it is easy to add a new built-in function or module to the interpreter, either to perform critical operations at maximum speed, or to link Python programs to libraries that may only be available in binary form (such as a vendor-specific graphics library). Once you are really hooked, you can link the Python interpreter into an application written in C and use it as an extension or command language for that application.
paras.cn: Python是可扩展的：如果你知道如何用C语言编程，那么很容易就能为解释器添加一个新的内置函数或模块，以最高速度执行关键操作，或者将Python程序链接到可能仅以二进制形式提供的库（如供应商特定的图形库）。一旦你真正入迷了，你就可以将Python解释器链接到用C语言编写的应用程序中，并将其用作该应用程序的扩展或命令语言。

vocab.ex: Python is extensible, allowing developers to add new functionality.
vocab.tr: Python是可扩展的，允许开发人员添加新功能。

vocab.ex: Python has many built-in data types like lists and dictionaries.
vocab.tr: Python拥有许多内置数据类型，如列表和字典。

vocab.ex: This operation is critical for the system's performance.
vocab.tr: 这个操作对系统的性能至关重要。

vocab.ex: Compiled programs are typically distributed in binary form.
vocab.tr: 编译后的程序通常以二进制形式分发。

vocab.ex: He got hooked on video games after trying one for the first time.
vocab.tr: 他第一次尝试了视频游戏后就沉迷其中了。

vocab.ex: Many applications allow integration with an extension language for customization.
vocab.tr: 许多应用程序允许与扩展语言集成以进行自定义。

paras.en: By the way, the language is named after the BBC show “Monty Python’s Flying Circus” and has nothing to do with reptiles. Making references to Monty Python skits in documentation is not only allowed, it is encouraged!
paras.cn: 顺便说一下，这门语言是以BBC的节目《蒙提·派森的飞行马戏团》命名的，与爬行动物毫无关系。在文档中引用蒙提·派森的短剧不仅是被允许的，而且是被鼓励的！

vocab.ex: By the way, did you finish your homework?
Snakes, lizards, and crocodiles are all reptiles.
The author made several references to historical events in his novel.
The comedy show featured several popular Monty Python skits.
Students are encouraged to ask questions during the lecture.

paras.en: Now that you are all excited about Python, you’ll want to examine it in some more detail. Since the best way to learn a language is to use it, the tutorial invites you to play with the Python interpreter as you read.
paras.cn: 现在你们都对Python感到兴奋了，你们会想更详细地研究它。既然学习一门语言最好的方法是使用它，那么本教程就邀请你在阅读的同时，玩转Python解释器。

vocab.ex: Please examine the documents carefully before signing them.
The Python interpreter executes code line by line.
The software allows users to interactively explore the data.
He wrote several throw-away scripts for testing small ideas.
The team used a bottom-up approach to build the software.

paras.en: In the next chapter, the mechanics of using the interpreter are explained. This is rather mundane information, but essential for trying out the examples shown later.
paras.cn: 在下一章中，将解释使用解释器的机械原理。这些信息相当平凡，但对于尝试后面所示的示例至关重要。

vocab.ex: I need to understand the mechanics of how this machine works.
We discussed the mundane details of the project.
It's essential to get enough sleep for good health.
Can you try out this new software?

paras.en: The rest of the tutorial introduces various features of the Python language and system through examples, beginning with simple expressions, statements and data types, through functions and modules, and finally touching upon advanced concepts like exceptions and user-defined classes.
paras.cn: 教程的其余部分将通过示例介绍Python语言和系统的各种功能，从简单的表达式、语句和数据类型开始，到函数和模块，最后涉及到高级概念，如异常和用户定义类。

vocab.ex: This chapter will introduce you to the basic concepts of Python programming.
In programming, an expression is a combination of values, variables, and operators.
A Python statement typically ends with a newline character.
Common data types include integers, strings, and booleans.
A program can be split into several modules for better organization.
Error handling in Python often involves try-except blocks to manage exceptions.
The programmer created several user-defined functions for specific tasks.
Object-oriented programming uses classes to create objects.

paras.en:
The Python interpreter is usually installed as /usr/local/bin/python3.11 on those machines where it is available; putting /usr/local/bin in your Unix shell’s search path makes it possible to start it by typing the command:

...to the shell. [1] Since the choice of the directory where the interpreter lives is an installation option, other places are possible; check with your local Python guru or system administrator. (E.g., /usr/local/python is a popular alternative location.)
paras.cn:
Python 解释器通常安装在可用机器的 /usr/local/bin/python3.11 路径下；将 /usr/local/bin 放入你的 Unix shell 搜索路径中，就可以通过在 shell 中键入以下命令来启动它：

……[1] 由于解释器所在的目录选择是一个安装选项，其他位置也是可能的；请咨询你本地的 Python 大师或系统管理员。（例如，/usr/local/python 是一个流行的备选位置。）

vocab.ex: The Python interpreter executes code line by line.
vocab.tr: Python 解释器逐行执行代码。

vocab.ex: You need to add the program's directory to your system's search path to run it from anywhere.
vocab.tr: 你需要将该程序的目录添加到系统的搜索路径中，才能从任何地方运行它。

vocab.ex: He is considered a marketing guru in the industry.
vocab.tr: 他被认为是行业内的营销大师。

vocab.ex: If the main road is closed, we'll have to find an alternative route.
vocab.tr: 如果主路关闭，我们将不得不寻找一条备用路线。

paras.en: On Windows machines where you have installed Python from the Microsoft Store, the python3.11 command will be available. If you have the py.exe launcher installed, you can use the py command. See Excursus: Setting environment variables for other ways to launch Python.
paras.cn: 在从 Microsoft Store 安装了 Python 的 Windows 机器上，python3.11 命令将可用。如果你安装了 py.exe 启动器，你可以使用 py 命令。有关启动 Python 的其他方法，请参阅附录：设置环境变量。

vocab.ex: The new game launcher provides a better user experience.
vocab.tr: 新的游戏启动器提供了更好的用户体验。

vocab.mean: （书中的）附录；离题的详细说明
vocab.ex: The author included an excursus on the historical context of the novel.
vocab.tr: 作者加入了一段关于小说历史背景的附录。

vocab.ex: You may need to set an environment variable to configure the software.
vocab.tr: 你可能需要设置一个环境变量来配置该软件。

paras.en: Typing an end-of-file character (Control-D on Unix, Control-Z on Windows) at the primary prompt causes the interpreter to exit with a zero exit status. If that doesn’t work, you can exit the interpreter by typing the following command: quit().
paras.cn: 在主提示符下键入文件结束符（Unix 上是 Control-D，Windows 上是 Control-Z）会导致解释器以零退出状态退出。如果这不起作用，你可以通过键入以下命令来退出解释器：quit()。

vocab.ex: The program stopped reading when it reached the end-of-file character.
vocab.tr: 程序在到达文件结束符时停止了读取。

vocab.ex: The command line showed a blinking cursor after the prompt.
vocab.tr: 命令行在提示符后显示一个闪烁的光标。

vocab.ex: A zero exit status usually indicates that the program ran successfully.
vocab.tr: 零退出状态通常表示程序成功运行。

paras.en: The interpreter’s line-editing features include interactive editing, history substitution and code completion on systems that support the GNU Readline library. Perhaps the quickest check to see whether command line editing is supported is typing Control-P to the first Python prompt you get. If it beeps, you have command line editing; see Appendix Interactive Input Editing and History Substitution for an introduction to the keys. If nothing appears to happen, or if ^P is echoed, command line editing isn’t available; you’ll only be able to use backspace to remove characters from the current line.
paras.cn: 解释器的行编辑功能包括在支持 GNU Readline 库的系统上的交互式编辑、历史替换和代码补全。也许检查是否支持命令行编辑的最快方法是在你得到的第一个 Python 提示符下键入 Control-P。如果它发出蜂鸣声，你就有命令行编辑功能；请参阅附录“交互式输入编辑和历史替换”以了解按键的介绍。如果似乎什么也没发生，或者回显了^P，则命令行编辑不可用；你将只能使用退格键来删除当前行的字符。

vocab.ex: Modern command shells offer powerful line-editing features.
vocab.tr: 现代的命令行外壳提供了强大的行编辑功能。

vocab.ex: Using history substitution can save you a lot of typing in the terminal.
vocab.tr: 在终端中使用历史替换可以为你节省大量打字时间。

vocab.ex: An integrated development environment (IDE) usually provides code completion to speed up programming.
vocab.tr: 集成开发环境（IDE）通常提供代码补全以加快编程速度。

vocab.ex: The terminal will echo each character you type.
vocab.tr: 终端会回显你输入的每个字符。

vocab.ex: He used the backspace key to delete the typo.
vocab.tr: 他用退格键删除了那个打字错误。

paras.en: The interpreter operates somewhat like the Unix shell: when called with standard input connected to a tty device, it reads and executes commands interactively; when called with a file name argument or with a file as standard input, it reads and executes a script from that file.
paras.cn: 解释器的操作有点像 Unix shell：当调用时标准输入连接到 tty 设备，它会交互式地读取和执行命令；当调用时带有文件名参数或以文件作为标准输入，它会从该文件读取并执行脚本。

vocab.ex: You need to learn how to operate this machine safely.
vocab.tr: 你需要学习如何安全地操作这台机器。

vocab.ex: By default, the program reads data from the standard input.
vocab.tr: 默认情况下，该程序从标准输入读取数据。

vocab.ex: The program's output was directed to a tty device.
vocab.tr: 程序的输出被定向到一个终端设备。

vocab.ex: Double-click the icon to execute the program.
vocab.tr: 双击图标以执行该程序。

vocab.ex: He wrote a Python script to automate the data backup process.
vocab.tr: 他写了一个Python脚本来自动化数据备份过程。

paras.en: A second way of starting the interpreter is python -c command [arg] ..., which executes the statement(s) in command, analogous to the shell’s -c option. Since Python statements often contain spaces or other characters that are special to the shell, it is usually advised to quote command in its entirety.
paras.cn: 启动解释器的第二种方法是 python -c command [arg] ...，它会执行 command 中的语句，类似于 shell 的 -c 选项。由于 Python 语句通常包含空格或其他对 shell 而言特殊的字符，通常建议将 command 完整地用引号引起来。

vocab.ex: The human brain is sometimes said to be analogous to a computer.
vocab.tr: 人脑有时被说成类似于一台电脑。

vocab.ex: You should quote the entire string to avoid errors.
vocab.tr: 你应该将整个字符串用引号引起来以避免错误。

vocab.ex: Please read the document in its entirety before signing.
vocab.tr: 请在签署前完整地阅读该文件。

paras.en: Some Python modules are also useful as scripts. These can be invoked using python -m module [arg] ..., which executes the source file for module as if you had spelled out its full name on the command line. When a script file is used, it is sometimes useful to be able to run the script and enter interactive mode afterwards. This can be done by passing -i before the script.
paras.cn: 一些 Python 模块也可以作为脚本使用。可以使用 python -m module [arg] ... 来调用它们，这会执行 module 的源文件，就像你在命令行上拼写出它的全名一样。当使用脚本文件时，有时能够在运行脚本后进入交互模式会很有用。这可以通过在脚本前传递 -i 来实现。

vocab.ex: You can invoke the function by calling its name with the required arguments.
vocab.tr: 你可以通过用所需参数调用函数名来调用该函数。

vocab.ex: Could you spell out your last name for me, please?
vocab.tr: 能请你为我拼一下你的姓吗？

vocab.ex: Let's have dinner first and go to the movies afterwards.
vocab.tr: 我们先吃晚饭，之后再去看电影。

vocab.ex: You need to pass the correct arguments to the function.
vocab.tr: 你需要向函数传递正确的参数。

paras.en: All command line options are described in Command line and environment.
paras.cn: 所有的命令行选项都在“命令行和环境”中有描述。

vocab.ex: Many developers prefer using the command line for its power and flexibility.
vocab.tr: 许多开发者因其功能强大和灵活性而偏爱使用命令行。

vocab.ex: The program has several command line options to customize its behavior.
vocab.tr: 该程序有几个命令行选项来定制其行为。

paras.en: When known to the interpreter, the script name and additional arguments thereafter are turned into a list of strings and assigned to the argv variable in the sys module. You can access this list by executing import sys. The length of the list is at least one; when no script and no arguments are given, sys.argv[0] is an empty string. When the script name is given as '-' (meaning standard input), sys.argv[0] is set to '-'. When -c command is used, sys.argv[0] is set to '-c'. When -m module is used, sys.argv[0] is set to the full name of the located module. Options found after -c command or -m module are not consumed by the Python interpreter’s option processing but left in sys.argv for the command or module to handle.
paras.cn: 当解释器知道脚本名和其后的附加参数时，它们会被转换成一个字符串列表，并赋给 sys 模块中的 argv 变量。你可以通过执行 import sys 来访问这个列表。该列表的长度至少为一；当没有给出脚本和参数时，sys.argv[0] 是一个空字符串。当脚本名被指定为'-'（表示标准输入）时，sys.argv[0] 被设置为'-'。当使用 -c command 时，sys.argv[0] 被设置为'-c'。当使用 -m module 时，sys.argv[0] 被设置为所定位模块的全名。在 -c command 或 -m module 之后找到的选项不会被 Python 解释器的选项处理过程消耗，而是留在 sys.argv 中供命令或模块处理。

vocab.ex: The script requires at least one command line argument to run.
vocab.tr: 该脚本需要至少一个命令行参数才能运行。

vocab.ex: You need to assign a value to the variable before you can use it.
vocab.tr: 在使用变量前，你需要先给它赋一个值。

vocab.ex: In algebra, 'x' is often used as a variable.
vocab.tr: 在代数中，'x' 常用作变量。

vocab.ex: The program will consume the input data and produce a result.
vocab.tr: 该程序将消耗输入数据并产生一个结果。

paras.en: When commands are read from a tty, the interpreter is said to be in interactive mode. In this mode it prompts for the next command with the primary prompt, usually three greater-than signs (>>>); for continuation lines it prompts with the secondary prompt, by default three dots (...). The interpreter prints a welcome message stating its version number and a copyright notice before printing the first prompt:
paras.cn: 当命令从 tty 读取时，解释器被称为处于交互模式。在这种模式下，它用主提示符（通常是三个大于号 >>>）来提示下一个命令；对于续行，它用次提示符（默认为三个点 ...）来提示。解释器在打印第一个提示符之前会打印一条欢迎信息，说明其版本号和版权声明：

vocab.ex: The interpreter's interactive mode is great for testing small code snippets.
vocab.tr: 解释器的交互模式非常适合测试小的代码片段。

vocab.ex: After launching the shell, you will see the primary prompt.
vocab.tr: 启动shell后，你会看到主提示符。

vocab.ex: When you enter a multi-line statement, the interpreter will show a prompt for each continuation line.
vocab.tr: 当你输入一个多行语句时，解释器会为每个续行显示一个提示符。

vocab.ex: The secondary prompt in Python is typically '...'.
vocab.tr: Python中的次提示符通常是‘...’。

vocab.ex: By default, the software saves files in the 'Documents' folder.
vocab.tr: 默认情况下，该软件将文件保存在“文档”文件夹中。

blocks.content:
python3.11
Python 3.11 (default, April 4 2021, 09:25:04)
[GCC 10.2.0] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.

paras.en:
Continuation lines are needed when entering a multi-line construct. As an example, take a look at this if statement:

For more on interactive mode, see Interactive Mode.
paras.cn:
在输入多行结构时需要续行。举个例子，看看这个 if 语句：

有关交互模式的更多信息，请参阅“交互模式”。

vocab.ex: He copied the multi-line error message and sent it to the support team.
vocab.tr: 他复制了那条多行的错误信息，并将其发送给了支持团队。

vocab.ex: The 'for' loop is a common programming construct for iteration.
vocab.tr: ‘for’循环是用于迭代的常见编程结构。

blocks.content:
>>> the_world_is_flat = True
>>> if the_world_is_flat:
...     print("Be careful not to fall off!")
...
Be careful not to fall off!

paras.en: By default, Python source files are treated as encoded in UTF-8. In that encoding, characters of most languages in the world can be used simultaneously in string literals, identifiers and comments — although the standard library only uses ASCII characters for identifiers, a convention that any portable code should follow. To display all these characters properly, your editor must recognize that the file is UTF-8, and it must use a font that supports all the characters in the file.
paras.cn: 默认情况下，Python 源文件被视为以 UTF-8 编码。在该编码中，世界上大多数语言的字符可以同时用于字符串字面量、标识符和注释中——尽管标准库只对标识符使用 ASCII 字符，这是任何可移植代码都应遵循的约定。要正确显示所有这些字符，你的编辑器必须能识别文件是 UTF-8 编码的，并且必须使用支持文件中所有字符的字体。

vocab.ex: The programmer edited the source file to fix a bug.
vocab.tr: 程序员编辑了源文件以修复一个错误。

vocab.ex: You need to encode the data before sending it over the network.
vocab.tr: 在通过网络发送数据之前，你需要对数据进行编码。

vocab.ex: He can't listen to music and study simultaneously.
vocab.tr: 他不能同时听音乐和学习。

vocab.ex: In Python, a string literal is created by enclosing text in quotes.
vocab.tr: 在Python中，通过将文本放在引号中来创建字符串字面量。

vocab.ex: A variable name is a type of identifier in programming.
vocab.tr: 变量名是编程中一种标识符。

vocab.ex: It's a common convention to name constant variables in all capital letters.
vocab.tr: 用全大写字母命名常量变量是一个常见的惯例。

vocab.ex: Writing portable code allows it to run on different operating systems without modification.
vocab.tr: 编写可移植的代码可以让它在不同操作系统上运行而无需修改。

paras.en: To declare an encoding other than the default one, a special comment line should be added as the first line of the file. The syntax is as follows:
paras.cn: 要声明一个不同于默认值的编码，应在文件的第一行添加一条特殊的注释行。语法如下：

vocab.ex: In some languages, you must declare a variable before using it.
vocab.tr: 在某些语言中，你必须在使用变量前先声明它。

vocab.ex: A small syntax error can prevent the entire program from running.
vocab.tr: 一个小的语法错误就能阻止整个程序运行。

paras.en: where encoding is one of the valid codecs supported by Python. For example, to declare that Windows-1252 encoding is to be used, the first line of your source code file should be:
paras.cn: 其中 encoding 是 Python 支持的有效编解码器之一。例如，要声明使用 Windows-1252 编码，你的源代码文件的第一行应为：

vocab.ex: You must enter a valid email address to register.
vocab.tr: 你必须输入一个有效的电子邮件地址才能注册。

vocab.ex: You might need to install a new codec to play this video file.
vocab.tr: 你可能需要安装一个新的编解码器才能播放这个视频文件。

paras.en: One exception to the first line rule is when the source code starts with a UNIX “shebang” line. In this case, the encoding declaration should be added as the second line of the file. For example:
paras.cn: 第一行规则的一个例外是当源代码以 UNIX 的 “shebang” 行开头时。在这种情况下，编码声明应作为文件的第二行添加。例如：

vocab.ex: Everyone must attend the meeting; there are no exceptions.
vocab.tr: 每个人都必须参加会议，没有例外。

vocab.ex: A Python script on Linux often starts with a shebang line like '#!/usr/bin/env python'.
vocab.tr: Linux上的Python脚本通常以像'#!/usr/bin/env python'这样的释伴行开头。
